channel.title: Police raid barbecue because man used Facebook to invite his friends
channel.description:
source: http://www.dailymail.co.uk/news/article-1200310/Police-raid-30th-birthday-barbecue-man-used-Facebook-invite-friends.html
Riot police raided a 30th birthday barbecue because they thought the organiser, who had invited his friends via Facebook, was staging a rave. Four police cars, a riot van and a helicopter moved in on Andrew Poole's gathering which was taking place in a field owned by a friend. The coach driver had invited 17 guests to an 'event' on his social networking page by private invitation and was about to light the barbecue when the gazebo suddenly started flapping wildly and the sound of chopper blades filled the air. A police helicopter circled the field several times before four police cars and a riot van stormed into the field in a small village near Sowton, Devon. Eight officers wearing camouflage trousers and body armour then jumped out and ordered the party to be shut down or everyone would be arrested. Andrew, of Exeter, Devon, said: 'It had started to rain so we had gone in under the gazebo. All of a sudden there was this noise in the sky - I honestly couldn't believe it. 'The thing then hovered over us for about 25 minutes, watching 15 people eat. They told us to take down the sound system and said everybody's got to leave. ...

item.title: Police raid barbecue because man used Facebook to invite his friends
item.dc:creator: @goatee goatee
item.description:
@goatee wrote:

And now we all know that guy is going to tell that story on every one of his birthdays for the rest of his life.

BTW I love BBQ.

Read full topic

item.title: Police raid barbecue because man used Facebook to invite his friends
item.dc:creator: @Aftermath_961 Aftermath
item.description:
@Aftermath_961 wrote:

Yes, I realize, but even so to call Russia third world is rather ridiculous. In addition, there’s no particular standard to when a country becomes ‘first world’, and furthermore, the separation between ‘developing’ and ‘developed’ nations implies that the ‘developed’ nations are economically stagnant, as they are not developing.

rantyrantyrantyranty, TL;DR: I disapprove of the slang usage of that term.

Read full topic

item.title: Police raid barbecue because man used Facebook to invite his friends
item.dc:creator: @cooper cooper
item.description:
@cooper wrote:

[quote=“Aftermath, post:17, topic:289560”][quote author=Mopman link=topic=382743.msg2875252#msg2875252 date=1248011808]

Speaking of Daily Mail:

http://www.dailymail.co.uk/news/article-1200620/Now-borrowing-Russian-helicopters-fight-Taliban.html

Russia - “Third world country”

It’s literally “First world” by definition.

Haha that is fuggin terrible

See what shit we have to put up with that calls itself media? You guys complain about fox, all we have is fox’s
[/quote]
Yar. Also, I meant second world. First world was US and allies.[/quote]
It’s no longer considered second world, after the fall of the U.S.S.R. “first world” changed to economically developed nations and “third world” changed to economically developing nations.

Read full topic
